item.title: Change back traffic light sequence, 12th February
item.description:
Since PE way has been resurfaced, the traffic is always grid locked , even during non - peak times. Please change / improve traffic light frequence to allow more cars to pass through at one time !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Pothole, 12th February
item.description:
Large pothole at junction of Andover Road and the Texaco roundabout. The pothole is in the left hand lane where cars give way to cars coming from the Cheltenham centre of Lansdown Road. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andover Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Issues with lots of running water on road, 12th February
item.description:
Long standing issue of lots of running and standing water on this road. Looks like a drain or pipework might be broken.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Signs and markings on the roundabout junction are not clear, 12th February
item.description:
The signs and road markings at the roundabout (left to Cheltenham/Shurdington, right to Brockworth) are not clear. Road users are unsure whether the middle or the right hand lane are to be used to go right and take the third exit on the roundabout to Brockworth and it is causing near misses when using this roundabout.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road Junction, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: 2 very large areas of road have literally come away since all the rain., 12th February
item.description:
Heading towards Shurdington, just inside the 50MPH zone. 2 very large areas of road have crumbled away. Can't avoid hitting them or you’d be on the other side of the carriageway. Very dangerous as road not lit so no chance of seeing them when dark. The same area, very near these potholes, was only repaired by a road closure around 6 months ago !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Awful dangerous pothole on Birdlip roundabout travelling towards ullenwood turning, 12th February
item.description:
I use this road to get to Birdlip every weekday, and have used this route for 6 years. The potholes have been really really dreadful for ages but are now just unbelievable. The one I encountered today as I travelled to Leckhampton was so bad it caused my wheel to crack at the impact, I can’t see it’s damaged but cd well have cracked or weakened my alloy. I will inspect further in the daylight tmw. There is no paint on the pothole and it’s right in the wheel area of cars. I am constantly having to move into the centre of the road morning and night to avoid these potholes that are literally littering this stretch of road. There WILL be a very serious accident very soon due to so many cars going into the rd centre to avoid them. I just can’t believe you can feel it is acceptable to leave this road in this awful neglected condition. It’s a death trap for cars and people
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verge overgrowing cycleway, 12th February
item.description:
